title: 'I wish I'd died': England cricket legend's devastating revelation
content: Andrew Flintoff, the former England cricket captain, has opened up about the profound impact of his near-fatal car crash during Top Gear filming in 2022. He candidly admits that he felt it would have been "much easier" if he had died, revealing the depth of his despair following the incident. Flintoff retired from cricket in 2010 at the age of 31, having represented England in 79 Test matches between 1998 and 2009.

title: 'They kept on laughing till my husband died': Wife laments inadequate security
content: Shital Kalathiya, wife of slain Surat banker Shailesh Kalathiya, has demanded justice following the Pahalgam terror attack. At her husband's funeral, attended by ministers and a large crowd, she criticized the security arrangements in Jammu and Kashmir. She alleged security forces failed to protect citizens and questioned why VIPs receive preferential treatment while her husband lacked essential security.

title: Microsoft HR head gives employees 5 days 'deadline' to ... or leave the company
content: Microsoft is implementing a new performance strategy, offering underperforming employees a severance package of 16 weeks' pay to voluntarily leave instead of entering a Performance Improvement Plan (PIP). Employees have five days to decide, and those choosing the PIP forfeit the payout.

title: 'Vladimir, STOP!': In rare criticism, Donald Trump urges Putin to end war
content: Donald Trump criticized Vladimir Putin following a massive Russian strike on Ukraine that resulted in casualties and significant damage. Trump urged Putin to stop the attacks, citing heavy troop losses and advocating for a peace deal. The strikes targeted Ukraine's aviation, aerospace, and defense industries, prompting President Zelenskyy to condemn Russia's actions and appeal for international awareness and accountability.

title: All Pakistan nationals ordered to leave India within 72 hrs
content: India has suspended all visas for Pakistani citizens. They must leave the country by April 27. Medical visas are valid until April 29. This decision follows the Pahalgam terror attack. PM Narendra Modi vowed to punish those responsible. Indians are advised against traveling to Pakistan. Those in Pakistan should return home soon.

title: Elon Musk's DOGE cancels 15 IBM projects, ending this longstanding practice
content: Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has canceled 15 federal contracts with IBM, totaling approximately $100 million. This move, part of DOGE's cost-cutting efforts, has led to a slight decline in IBM's consulting revenue. While IBM downplays the overall impact, the cancellations signal increased scrutiny on federal spending and the challenges for contractors.

title: ‘Very close’: India may be first to sign trade pact, says US treasury secy
content: India may soon be the first nation to strike a bilateral trade deal with the US under President Trump's reciprocal tariff policy, according to US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent. Negotiations are reportedly near a breakthrough, facilitated by India's relatively low tariffs and minimal trade barriers.

title: 'Act of war': Pak reacts to India's big move after J&K attack
content: Following a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Prime Minister Modi pledged decisive action against those responsible, vowing to "identify, track, and punish" the perpetrators. Pakistan responded sharply, warning that any threat to its sovereignty would be met with "firm reciprocal measures." Islamabad condemned India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty as an "Act of War," and took retaliatory measures, including airspace closure, trade suspension, and the expulsion of Indian military advisors.

title: Air pollution in US: These 10 major cities are most affected
content: A new report from the American Lung Association reveals that over 25 million more Americans are breathing polluted air, increasing health risks. Climate events like wildfires and heatwaves are worsening air quality, especially in the West Coast and areas affected by Canadian wildfires.

title: Cake delivery for Pakistan High Commission goes viral after Pahalgam attack
content: Amidst outrage over the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 28 tourists, a video showing a man carrying a cake to the Pakistan High Commission has sparked controversy. Simultaneously, protests erupted in Delhi, with demonstrators demanding decisive action against Pakistan.

title: Shami calls Hardik Pandya 'bhai' and asks for his autograph
content: Rohit Sharma's brilliant 70 and a 53-run partnership with Suryakumar Yadav propelled Mumbai Indians to a dominant seven-wicket victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad. Mumbai chased down the 144-run target with ease, securing their fourth consecutive win. Earlier, Heinrich Klaasen's 71 helped SRH recover to 143/8, but it wasn't enough to stop Mumbai's momentum.

title: Shaken Pak blocks airspace for Indian airlines, closes Wagah
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that claimed 28 lives, India has taken strong diplomatic action against Pakistan, accusing it of supporting cross-border terrorism. Measures include suspending the Indus Water Treaty, closing the Attari border crossing, and cancelling SAARC visas for Pakistani nationals. Pakistan is set to convene a National Security Committee meeting to formulate a response to India's actions.

title: 'Got invite to all-party meet': Owaisi after urging PM Modi to include small parties
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi initially criticized the Centre for excluding smaller parties from the all-party meeting on the Pahalgam terror attack. He highlighted that every party with parliamentary representation deserves a voice on this national issue. Subsequently, Owaisi received an invitation following his remarks and confirmed his attendance.

title: Pahalgam attack: 9-yr-old lights father's pyre after mother faints
content: Nine-year-old Tanuj Kumar Satpathy tragically lit his father Prashant's funeral pyre in Balasore, Odisha, after Prashant was killed in the Pahalgam terror attack. Grieving relatives struggled as Prashant's wife, Priya Darshini, clung to his body. The funeral was attended by hundreds, including Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi.

title: Gulki Joshi reacts to being approached for Khatron Ke Khiladi
content: Gulki Joshi expressed her strong interest in joining the upcoming season of Khatron Ke Khiladi, revealing she was initially approached but received no further updates. Despite her eagerness and love for balancing and aerial stunts, Joshi remains uncertain about her participation, especially with rumors circulating about the show's potential cancellation.

title: Pakistan captain Rizwan loses cool, throws helmet: Watch
content: Islamabad United showcased a dominant batting display, securing a convincing seven-wicket victory over Multan Sultans in their recent PSL encounter. Andries Gous's explosive unbeaten 80 led United's successful chase of 169, overshadowing Usman Khan's earlier 61 for the Sultans. Mohammad Rizwan's frustration was evident as Multan struggled to contain Islamabad's fluent response.

title: Pakistan Super League to stop streaming in India: Here’s why
content: FanCode has suspended the broadcast of PSL 2025 in India, effective immediately, following the tragic terror attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, which resulted in the loss of many lives. The decision reflects the national sentiment and sensitivity towards the incident. During the IPL match, players honored the victims with black armbands and a moment of silence.

title: Sikh pilgrims allowed to enter Pakistan as India closes Attari border
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and India's subsequent actions against Pakistan, the Attari border crossing is closed, but the Dera Baba Nanak ICP remains open. Approximately 250 Sikh pilgrims crossed into Pakistan via the Kartarpur Corridor to visit Gurdwara Kartarpur Sahib.

title: India’s youngest Asiad medallist, now only woman at World C'ships: Anahat
content: Anahat Singh, a 17-year-old squash player, has qualified for the World Squash Championships. She defeated Toby Tse in the Asian qualifiers. Anahat is the youngest Indian to achieve this feat. Her family has a strong sports background. She was initially inspired by P V Sindhu to play badminton but then switched to squash.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Indian Navy test fires missile in Arabian Sea
content: INS Surat, the Indian Navy's advanced destroyer, successfully test-fired a medium-range surface-to-air missile with a 70-km range in the Arabian Sea. Commissioned in January 2025, the ship showcases India's naval self-reliance with 75% indigenous content. This test occurs after PM Modi's strong warning to terrorists following the Pahalgam attack, vowing decisive action and justice.

title: He is 95, lives alone, and is happier and healthier than ever: Here’s how
content: At 95, Dr. Bankey Lal Sharma exemplifies a fulfilling life through routine, mental clarity, and emotional strength. There’s no miracle cure to living a long and joyful life. But Dr Bankey Lal Sharma’s story offers something even more valuable—a blueprint for emotional richness and inner peace. Through discipline, solitude, and simplicity, he has created a life full of meaning.

title: 'Every drop is ours by right': Pakistan reacts to suspension of Indus Waters Treaty
content: Pakistan's power minister responded strongly to India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, calling it an act of "water warfare." This reaction follows India's announcement of retaliatory measures against Pakistan for allegedly supporting cross-border terrorism, including holding the treaty in abeyance and imposing travel restrictions. Tensions escalate as both nations take firm stances.

title: 'Would’ve been better if they killed us Kashmiris’: Hawker who braved bullets
content: In a powerful act of bravery and compassion, Sajad Ahmad Bhat, a shawl hawker from Pahalgam, carried injured tourists to safety after the terror attack in Baisaran Valley that killed 28. Responding selflessly, Sajad and others rushed to aid victims, offering water and support. His gesture has drawn widespread praise, showcasing Kashmir’s humanity amid tragedy.

title: Steve Kerr makes his feelings known about Jimmy Butler after pelvis injury
content: Steve Kerr expressed concern for Jimmy Butler after he suffered a pelvis contusion during Wednesday's loss to the Rockets. Kerr stated that Thompson's contact with Butler was unintentional and a clean play. Jonathan Kuminga stepped up in Butler's absence, scoring 11 points, while maintaining a positive attitude despite recent bench time, and is ready to contribute.

title: Kesari Chapter 2' box office collection day 7 nears Rs 50 Cr
content: Kesari Chapter 2 is performing well at the box office. The movie earned Rs 39.00 crore in India in six days. The film had a strong opening weekend. Despite a mid-week slowdown, theater occupancy remains decent. Akshay Kumar's performance is receiving praise. Positive word of mouth is helping the film. Trade analysts predict a good second weekend for the movie.

title: 'Time to destroy remaining land of terror': PM hints at big action after J&K attack
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has vowed decisive action against those responsible for the Pahalgam terror attack, which claimed 28 lives. Addressing the nation, he promised to identify, track, and punish the perpetrators, assuring that terrorists will face unprecedented consequences.

title: Woman, who refused to attend Estonia award to look after buffalo, nominated in NY fest
content: Eighty-year-old Hira Devi, a farmer from Uttarakhand, and co-star Padam Singh, a retired soldier, have been nominated for Best Actor at the New York Indian Film Festival for their roles in Pyre. Directed by Vinod Kapri, the film captures their real lives in a ghost village. Despite no prior acting experience, their poignant performances have earned global acclaim.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Why PM Modi switched to English at Bihar rally
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, Prime Minister Narendra Modi issued a stern warning, vowing to identify, track, and punish every terrorist and their backers. Speaking in Bihar's Madhubani, Modi declared India's resolve to pursue them to the ends of the Earth, switching to English to address the international community. ""Every effort will be made to ensure justice is done, entire nation is firm in resolve," he said.

title: Kanye West hosts casting calls in his warehouse; enraged neighbors complain
content: Controversial artist Kanye West faces backlash in L.A.'s Larchmont neighborhood due to disruptive activities near his warehouse. Residents complain of loud music, including West's own songs, and disturbing 'URGENT' casting call advertisements. Allegations include swastika imagery and concerns about the impact on children near a school. Law enforcement has received multiple complaints, with investigations ongoing into potential hate crimes.

title: Man arrested in MP for offensive social media post on Pahalgam terror attack
content: Madhya Pradesh police arrested Mohammad Osaf Khan in Jabalpur for posting an offensive comment on social media regarding the Pahalgam terror attack. The arrest, made swiftly after the post, follows similar actions in Damoh district against individuals sharing inflammatory content related to the same incident.

title: 9 killed in Ukraine as Russia fires 70 missiles, 150 drones overnight
content: Russia launched a massive overnight strike on Ukraine, targeting its defence industry with nearly 70 missiles and 150 drone attacks, resulting in nine deaths and over 80 injuries. The strikes damaged plants in Kyiv that produced rocket fuel and gunpowder. President Zelenskyy condemned the attack, highlighting Russia's violation of ceasefire agreements and calling for strengthened air defences and global diplomatic efforts.

title: Yograj Singh’s jaw-dropping comment on Sachin Tendulkar’s son Arjun Tendulkar
content: Yograj Singh, Yuvraj Singh's father, believes Arjun Tendulkar could emulate Chris Gayle's batting prowess if he concentrates more on his batting skills. He suggests Yuvraj mentor Arjun for a few months, drawing from his close relationship with Sachin Tendulkar.

title: Fawad Khan's 'Abir Gulal' will not release in India following the Pahalgam attack
content: The upcoming Bollywood debut of Pakistani actor Fawad Khan in 'Abir Gulal' has sparked controversy, intensified by the recent Pahalgam attack. Amidst national grief and outrage, the I&B Ministry has reportedly withheld the film's release in India. Khan condemned the 'horrific' attack in Pahalgam, where 26 lives were lost.

title: Tesla's profits plunged by 71% in Q1 2025. Can Elon Musk turn it around?
content: Tesla faces a significant challenge as profits plummet by 71% due to backlash against Elon Musk's political involvement and support for controversial figures. European sales have sharply declined, triggering protests and brand damage. Despite competition from BYD and other manufacturers, Musk plans to refocus on Tesla, promising autonomous driving advancements and increased attention to the company.

title: Formal job creation may hit record high in FY 2024-25; here’s what EPFO data suggests
content: India's formal job sector is booming, with projections indicating a record-breaking 14.5 million net additions in fiscal year 2024-25, surpassing previous highs. While new EPFO registrations have dipped, possibly due to lack of incentives, increased formalization driven by wage digitization is fueling job growth. Government initiatives like employment-linked incentives are expected to further boost establishment registrations.

title: Arshad Nadeem snubs Neeraj Chopra's NC Classic javelin event
content: Pakistani Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem has declined Neeraj Chopra's invitation to compete in the NC Classic javelin event in Bengaluru on May 24, citing a conflict with his training schedule for the Asian Athletics Championships. While expressing gratitude to Chopra, Nadeem confirmed his commitment to the Asian Championship in Gumi, Korea, from May 27 to 31.

title: Samsung may shift production to India from Vietnam amidst Trump’s tariff moves
content: Samsung is seeking a one-year extension to India's production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme for smartphones after missing targets in the second year. The company aims to secure incentives for a full five years, potentially receiving ₹3,200 crore for its participation.

title: J&K attack: Newlyweds fled on horseback with gunshots ringing in the air
content: Barely two months into their marriage, Komal and Mihir's idyllic Pahalgam escape turned into a nightmare when a terrorist attack struck Baisaran meadow. Amidst the chaos of gunfire and falling bodies, the couple fled on horseback, their dream vacation shattered.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Andhra techie, banker shot dead in front of families
content: Telugu families are expressing disbelief and shock after narrowly escaping a deadly attack in Kashmir. Just days before the tragic event, many had been enjoying the same scenic locations, hiking and creating memories.

title: Best over for US stocks? Jefferies’ Chris Wood makes big prediction
content: Jefferies' Christopher Wood predicts a decline in US stocks, Treasury bonds, and the dollar, suggesting the US market has peaked, similar to Japan in 1989. He advises investors to rebalance portfolios by adding Chinese, Indian, and European assets.

title: Video shows man entering Pak High Commission with cake amid Pahalgam attack
content: Tensions escalate between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack, claimed by TRF, leading to India downgrading diplomatic ties and suspending the Indus Water Treaty. India served a persona non grata notice to Pakistani military diplomats. Amidst this, a man carrying a cake was seen entering the Pakistan High Commission in Delhi, while security measures were heightened.

title: Gold prices dip by Rs 3,800 per 10 grams in 2 days after touching Rs 1 lakh mark
content: Gold prices experienced a significant two-day decline of Rs 3,800 following remarks from US President Trump. MCX gold futures initially rose on Thursday but followed mixed settlements in domestic and international markets on Wednesday.

title: What is UPI circle? All you need to know about NPCI's new delegated payment system
content: UPI Circle, launched by NPCI on the BHIM app, enables delegated payments with security and oversight, expanding financial inclusion. Primary users can authorize secondary users to make transactions within set limits, benefiting those lacking digital literacy or bank accounts. This structured approach reduces cash reliance and increases transparency for families and businesses.

title: Schrager's mock draft: 32 predictions based on sources in the league
content: Peter Schrager's debut piece for ESPN is a Round 1 mock draft based on what he's hearing from his sources.

title: Warriors' Butler exits after hard fall, set for MRI
content: Warriors star Jimmy Butler suffered a pelvis contusion that forced him out of the Game 2 loss to the Rockets.

title: Hall of Famer Steve 'Mongo' McMichael dies at 67
content: Hall of Fame defensive tackle Steve McMichael, who was diagnosed with ALS in 2021, died Wednesday at age 67, the NFL announced.

title: Bloodied KP fires up C's: Won't let teams 'punk us'
content: Kristaps Porzingis laughed off a bloody gash on his forehead late in the third quarter of Boston's Game 2 win, saying he knew his reaction would fire up the Celtics crowd.

title: Chippy series to Rockets' advantage, Udoka says
content: The Rockets felt right at home in a win over the Warriors on Wednesday that featured six technical fouls, a flagrant 1, minor scuffles and multiple chants aimed at Draymond Green.

title: Titans add veteran WR Lockett on eve of draft
content: The Titans are signing veteran wide receiver Tyler Lockett to a one-year, $4 million deal that could be worth up to $6 million, a source told ESPN.

title: Judge delays House settlement over roster limits
content: The judge overseeing the multibillion-dollar settlement has delayed final approval until the deal is modified to address concerns about roster limits.

title: Judge drops suit against Morant, cites self-defense
content: A judge ruled that Grizzlies star Ja Morant acted in self-defense and was immune from civil liability in the suit filed by Joshua Holloway.

title: Johnson says she's returning to LSU for last year
content: Flau'jae Johnson put to rest any doubts about her future Wednesday, telling Front Office Sports that she will be returning to LSU for her senior season.

title: Cheat sheet: Everything you need to know on top prospects, team needs, projections
content: Who are the best players in the class? Which teams need a QB? Here's our one-stop guide to the draft.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Can Senators, Blues turn the tide at home?
content: Both clubs are down 0-2 heading into Game 3. Plus, it's Game 2 of the Battle of Florida! Here's what to know.

title: Bad Boys and 'Detroit energy': What's behind this record-setting turnaround for the Pistons
content: The Pistons finished with one of the worst records in NBA history last season. Now, they enter Thursday's Game 3 tied 1-1 with the Knicks. What changed in Detroit?

title: Welcome to the Cheap Seats at Clemson, home of college baseball's rowdiest fans
content: Fans in the raucous right-field grandstand at Doug Kingsmore Stadium have been ragging opposing teams for more than two decades.

title: For Rich Rodriguez and West Virginia is second time a charm?
content: Rodriguez led West Virginia to prominence when he was its head coach in the aughts. Can he work his magic again in 2025?

title: Ian Darke's Premier League flops of the season: Højlund, Foden, more
content: It's not been the easiest season for Man United or Rasmus Højlund, but who else has notably underperformed in the Premier League this season? Ian Darke makes his picks.

title: Madrid's Camavinga (adductor) out for season
content: Real Madrid midfielder Eduardo Camavinga will miss the remainder of the season, including Saturday's Copa del Rey final against Barcelona, because of a left adductor injury.

title: Sources: Arsenal confident in Zubimendi deal
content: Arsenal are confident they will make Real Sociedad midfielder Martín Zubimendi their first major summer signing despite interest from Real Madrid, sources have told ESPN.

title: Ancelotti scolds Endrick for 'clowning' vs. Getafe
content: Real Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti has scolded Endrick after his missed goal-scoring opportunity in Wednesday's 1-0 LaLiga win at Getafe.

title: Kane set to end trophy drought as Bayern eye title
content: Bayern Munich will secure the Bundesliga title on Saturday with a win over top-four hopefuls Mainz if rivals and reigning champions Bayer Leverkusen fail to beat Augsburg.

title: Man United women to play in $5m World 7s event
content: Manchester United will take part in the inaugural World Sevens football tournament at the end of May in Portugal.

title: Vardy to leave Leicester: 'Our greatest-ever player'
content: Jamie Vardy will leave Leicester City at the end of the season, the Premier League club confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Miami trades forward Robert Taylor to Austin FC
content: Inter Miami CF traded forward Robert Taylor to Austin FC for $750,000 in allocation money, the two clubs announced Monday.

title: Arena: Poch doesn't understand culture of USMNT
content: Former USMNT coach Bruce Arena has criticized the appointment of current head coach Mauricio Pochettino, saying that a non-American lacks the necessary understanding of the country's culture.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: How does Cam Ward compare to other QBs who boosted draft stock in final collegiate season?
content: Cam Ward didn't finish his career where he started, but he went out strong. Here are other QBs who have done the same.

title: Bracketology: First look at 2026 has familiar teams on top line
content: South Carolina, UConn, UCLA and Texas are the No. 1 seeds in our first projection of the 2026 bracket.

title: Rankings, projections, strategy and cheat sheets
content: Rankings, projections, player profiles, draft strategies -- we've got everything you need to dominate your fantasy women's basketball draft from every angle.

title: Time to rethink your Coors Field strategy
content: Start Colorado Rockies' bats at home and avoid visiting pitchers? That old standby strategy may be no more.

title: Chris Eubank Jr.-Conor Benn timeline: How their rivalry unfolded
content: Nick Parkinson looks at the rivalry between Eubank and Benn that started decades ago between their fathers.

title: Thompson leads USWNT in ranking, but other internationals dominate
content: The NWSL MVP Tracker is back for 2025 to rank the best players, as Alyssa Thompson tries to catch Debinha and Temwa Chawinga.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Liverpool join Huijsen race
content: Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool and Newcastle United are all after Bournemouth's Spain international defender Dean Huijsen. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: A.P. Minister urges medical fraternity to strengthen healthcare in government hospitals
content: As government hospitals are the hope of the low-income groups, they should provide the public with consistent, accessible, and reliable healthcare, says Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy

title: EPF scheme is most suited for construction workers, says Provident Fund Commissioner
content: EPF, through its contributory, account-linked, and tech-enabled framework, offers a far more resilient, scalable, and sustainable approach to worker’s protection and interest, says commissioner

title: Accused awarded death sentence in Ambalamukku murder case
content: Kanyakumari native Rajendran fatally stabbed Vineetha at the nursery she was working in the capital and stole her gold chain weighing 4.5 sovereigns. He is the prime accused in a 2014 triple homicide in Tamil Nadu

title: Vast scope for growth of aerospace and defence manufacturing sector in Andhra Pradesh, says former DRDO chief Satheesh Reddy
content: He promises to work with officials concerned in identifying locations for developing defence clusters

title: Thiruvathukkal twin murder: Assam native remanded in judicial custody
content: He tells police that he had only intended to target Vijayakumar but killed Meera as well after she woke up on hearing the noise

title: 25 highly accident-prone zones identified in Chittoor district
content: Collector instructs police and road transport authorities to chalk out an action plan to ground corrective measures at the black spots

title: CWC-TAC recommends techno-economic viability nod for Sitarama LI, Sitammasagar projects
content: The clearance is set to pace up the multipurpose project works with the committee meet chaired by MoJS Secretary clearing DPR

title: Dharwad officials asked to implement govt. schemes effectively
content: Labour Minister has directed taluk panchayat executive officers to resolve any drinking water problems immediately

title: Jagan pays tributes to terror victims; pats YSRCP leaders for bypoll performance
content: Party rank and file showed commitment during the recent byelections and the no-confidence motions were a testament to the strength of the party, he says

title: VTU asks students to cultivate wide reading habit
content: The university’s centres of excellence are training students in entrepreneurship, according to Vice-Chancellor

title: More than 350 people killed in road accidents annually in Chittoor district: SP
content: Manikanta Chandolu flags off a bike rally, split into three groups, which covered the vital junctions of Murakambattu, Reddygunta and Sambayya Kandriga, to promote the compulsory wearing of helmets

title: TNSTC plans to reschedule bus routes after the new bus stand at Panjapur becomes operational
content: The average distance per trip for the city buses may increase by 5 km, say officials; all the buses from Panjapur will go via Central Bus Stand and Tiruchi Junction

title: BSF jawan detained by Pakistan Rangers after accidentally crossing border
content: Constable P.K. Singh of the 182nd battalion was apprehended by the Pakistan Rangers across the Ferozepur border; talks are on between the two forces to secure his release

title: Supreme Court to examine POCSO clause requiring mandatory reporting of sexual activity
content: The Legislature had intended the requirement for mandatorily reporting sexual activity under Section 19 of the POCSO to prioritise timely intervention and protection of children

title: Maternal mortality ratio and infant mortality rate improve in Tiruchi city
content: Tiruchi city’s MMR stood at 33.1 per one lakh live births from 2024-25. A total of three maternal deaths were recorded out of 9,062 live births in the city

title: Land pooling preferred over acquisition for international airport in Amaravati, says Municipal Administration Minister Narayana
content: The government will go for acquisition only if farmers do not come forward to give land voluntarily, he says, and insists that the capital city needs a dedicated airport for it to develop and thrive

title: Summer vacation throws up a learning opportunity for children
content: The Andanallur block education officials have launched the Symbiotic Learning Model for children in Class I to V, an initiative to prevent learning loss during vacation

title: Arunachal to build memorial for IAF corporal slain in Pahalgam terror attack
content: Chief Minister Pema Khandu announced a job for a member of Tage Hailyang’s family and ₹50 lakh as assistance

title: Srirangam railway station ready after renovation
content: The Railways had allocated ₹5.14 crore for the upgrade of Srirangam station that falls along the Villupuram-Tiruchi chord line section via Vriddhachalam and Ariyalur

title: Congress observes Chettur’s death anniversary, accuses BJP of appropriating its leaders
content: K. Muraleedharan says the party has not organised State-wide commemoration of the first Keralite Congress president since Chettur had serious differences with Gandhi. BJP had accused the Congress of sidelining leaders not part of the Nehru family

title: Chittoor MP condemns Pahalgam tragedy
content: Daggumalla Prasad Rao extends his condolences to the family members of the victims and wishes the injured a speedy recovery

title: Pahalgam attack: Pakistan suspends including Simla Agreement; closes airspace for India
content: “Any attempt to stop or divert the flow of water belonging to Pakistan as per the Indus Waters Treaty, and the usurpation of the rights of lower riparian will be considered as an Act of War and responded with full force,” Pakistan said

title: Daily Quiz | Sachin Tendulkar’s IPL performance
content: As Bharat Ratna Sachin Tendulkar celebrates his 52nd birthday today, here’s a quiz on his IPL performance

title: PM Modi urges industry to come together to build a resilient, revolutionary, and steel-strong India
content: Prime Minister Modi urges steel industry to strengthen global partnerships, increase production, and aim for zero imports

title: Parents of medical student express doubts over death of their son, in Visakhapatnam
content: Victim’s mother Uma Devi alleged that police have not taken proper action on the management, which has political clout

title: Pahalgam terror attack: India revokes visa services to Pakistani nationals with immediate effect
content: The Ministry of External Affairs said all existing valid visas issued by India to Pakistani nationals stand revoked with effect from April 27

title: Pahalgam terror attack: ‘We went to Kashmir believing that heaven on Earth is safe’
content: Pallavi from Shivamogga, whose husband was killed in the Pahalgam terror attack, narrated how the horrific incident unfolded, and the absence of security personnel

title: SC gives green signal for notification of new UGC Regulations to fight campus discrimination
content: SC says a National Task Force formed to make recommendations to protect students from campus discrimination, address their mental health concerns will continue, if possible, fill up any lacunae in the 2025 Regulations

title: T.N. government to establish residential coaching centre in Chennai to assist civil services exam aspirants: CM Stalin
content: He said the ‘Naan Mudhalvan’ scheme was launched with the aim of enhancing the skills of students in Tamil Nadu

title: A daughter recollects traumatic gunning down of her father
content: The militant, who approached them while they were fleeing the fenced area of the valley along with many others, asked them to lie on the ground

title: Kerala’s online registration service gets popular among migrant workers
content: Over 22,000 workers registered within a year in Kozhikode district using a specially designed app and portal of the Labour department

title: Home Department directed to be vigilant regarding foreign nationals overstaying in Karnataka, says CM
content: Referring to the Pahalgam terror attack, Mr. Siddaramaiah said it was highly condemnable and inhumane

title: Madras High Court reverses discharge of T.N. Minister Duraimurugan from yet another disproportionate assets case
content: This case relates to the check period between 2007 and 2009; the court on Wednesday reversed an order discharging the Minister from another case registered for the check period between 1996 and 2001

title: Government waives upfront payment, offers rebates instead to expedite underground coal mining
content: Government introduces new incentives to promote underground coal mining, including waiving upfront payment and reducing revenue share

title: FIR against BJP IT cell in Karnataka for defamatory post on Rahul Gandhi
content: C.M. Dhananjaya, spokesperson and chairman of KPCC legal and human resources department, said that the BJP IT cell post on social media suggesting that Rahul Gandhi’s foreign trip is linked to the terror attack in Pahalgam, Kashmir

title: U.S. Vice-President J.D. Vance leaves for Washington from Jaipur
content: U.S. Vice-President J.D. Vance and family, who visited India, touring Jaipur, Agra, and met PM Modi, left for Washington on a special aircraft from Jaipur Airport

title: T.N. Startup Summit: ‘An idea is built, iterated, and refined by students before going to market’
content: Speaking during a session, Dr. Ananth Kumar, Associate Director of Entrepreneurship and Innovation at SRM Institute of Science and Technology, said, “This sort of cycle helps students grow, as the idea goes through multiple iterations and, at some point, becomes ready for the market.”

title: A new era begins; AI must power governance with a human touch: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: Chandrababu Naidu was addressing a workshop on Artificial Intelligence and Emerging Technologies for Government Digital Transformation at the Secretariat

title: Madras High Court orders notice on plea to disqualify T.N. Minister Ponmudy
content: Judges also record the statement of PIL petitioner that he shall redact objectionable statements made against Chief Minister M.K. Stalin in his affidavit

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Karnataka Governor, CM pay last respects to Bharat Bhushan in Bengaluru
content: Governor Gehlot visited the family and offered his condolences, consoling Bharat Bhushan’s wife and other family members. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, after offering homage, strongly condemned the attack

title: Fever affect children in Andhra Pradesh’s Neredubandha; tribals demand holding of medical camp in village
content: Girijan Sangham leaders have sought immediate visit by district-level officials and holding of a health camp to treat the children

title: Supreme Court to hear on pleas of Gujarat government, Godhra train burning case convicts on May 6, 7
content: Supreme Court to commence final hearing on Godhra train burning case appeals, including Gujarat Government’s plea for death penalty

title: Three Maoists killed in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur
content: While three bodies have been recovered, the police suspect there could be more Maoists killed even as the exchange of fire was reportedly on in a forest in Karegutta hills in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur district along the inter-State border

title: T.N. to soon establish university named after Karunanidhi in Kumbakonam: CM Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin said the varsity would honour Karunanidhi’s efforts towards the development of education in Tamil Nadu and his role in the formulation of various educational initiatives

title: T.N. Startup Summit: Panellists stress need for policy framework that fosters inclusivity in startups
content: During a session on ‘Building a diverse startup ecosystem: inclusion and gender equality’, panellists discussed the power of inclusive technology, role of academic institutions in fostering the same, and how inclusion must be unbiased

title: Congress calls for analysis on ‘intelligence failures’, ‘security lapses’ that led to Pahalgam terror attack
content: Congress Working Committee seeks analysis on Pahalgam terror attack, blames Pakistan, calls for security improvements and unity

title: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi pays homage to Manjunath Rao in Shivamogga, appeals to people to stay united to fight terrorism
content: The Minister said the Central government had already taken diplomatic measures in reaction to the attack

title: Railways to run second special train from Jammu's Katra to Delhi on April 24
content: It will start from Shri Vaishno Devi Katra, and halt at several stations such as Udhampur, Jammu, Pathankot, Jalandhar, Ambala, Kurukshetra and Panipat before terminating at the New Delhi Railway Station

title: T.N. SHRC recommends action against government schoolteacher in Sivaganga for forcing student to do 600 sit-ups
content: The girl, who was a class VII student, had attained puberty only 10 days before the 2017 incident that led to severe stomach pain, heavy bleeding, vomiting, diarrhoea and severe fever. She spent six days in the ICU ward of Government Sivaganga Medical College Hospital

title: Murshidabad violence: Five more held for rioting, total arrests now at 307
content: The arrested persons, nabbed from different places in the district on Wednesday (April 23, 2025), had direct links to the riots in which three people were killed and several injured, a senior officer said

title: Tamil Nadu’s startup growth a reflection of its potential, says Atul Anand at T.N. Startup Summit 2025
content: “One of the reasons [for the State’s success] is our multisectoral approach. It is a rich mix that will make Tamil Nadu the hub of the startup ecosystem,” said the Additional Chief Secretary, MSME Department, at the Tamil Nadu Startup Summit 2025

title: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti urges Amit Shah to ensure safety of Kashmiris
content: There have been many incidents across the country wherein Kashmiri students are being harassed, beaten up, bullied and even asked to vacate their residential premises, said People's Conference president Sajad Lone

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Terrorism breathing its last; nation must believe in PM Modi's leadership, says Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath
content: Yogi Adityanath said targeting of innocent individuals based on their religious identity, especially in front of their families, is intolerable

title: Robert Vadra’s remarks on Pahalgam attack spark row; BJP accuses him of using ‘language of terrorists’
content: Robert Vadra sparks controversy by suggesting non-Muslims were targeted in Pahalgam because terrorists feel Muslims are being “mistreated”; BJP demands apology

title: What Is The Simla Agreement And How Pak Has Violated It In The Past
content: India has ramped up its response to the Pahalgam terror attacks, revoking all visas issued to Pakistani nationals, including medical visas, and suspending visa services for Pakistanis.

title: "Terrorist Was Laughing After Shooting My Husband": Pahalgam Attack Victim's Wife
content: The wife of Surat resident Shailesh Kalathiya, who lost his life in the terror attack in Kashmir's Pahalgam, on Thursday said terrorists showed no remorse as they were seen laughing after shooting her husband dead.

title: Pakistan Cites Right To Suspend "All Bilateral Pacts, Including Simla"
content: With its back against the wall and no other options available, Pakistan's top committee on security met today and after an hours-long discussion decided to mirror India's actions in the wake of the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: All Party Meet Underway; India, Pakistan In Diplomatic Standoff
content: Pahalgam terror attack updates: Tensions between India and Pakistan over the terror attack in Pahalgam in Jammu & Kashmir's Anantnag district escalated on Thursday.

title: China Launches 3 Astronauts To Its Space Station
content: China sent three astronauts to its permanently inhabited space station on Thursday, in its 15th crewed spaceflight and the 20th overall in the Shenzhou program that started over three decades ago.

title: Arunachal To Construct Memorial For IAF Corporal Killed In Pahalgam Attack
content: Indian Air Force Corporal Tage Hailyang, who was vacationing in Pahalgam with his wife, risked his life and guided tourists to safety, helping them escape before he fell to the bullets of the terrorists, Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister said.

title: Assam MLA Arrested For Pulwama, Pahalgam "Government Conspiracy Comment
content: An MLA in Assam has been arrested over his comments on the terror attacks in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam and Pulwama.

title: India Orders Pak Nationals To Leave, Revokes Visas; Islamabad Reacts
content: Ramping up its response after the five measures announced on Wednesday, India has revoked all visas issued to Pakistani nationals, including medical visas, and suspended visa services for Pakistanis.

title: 'Hamas Leaders Visited PoK': Israel Envoy On Link With Pak-Based Lashkar
content: Israel's Ambassador to India, Reuven Azar, today compared the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam to the October 7, 2023 Hamas strike on Israel, citing similarities in their targeting of civilians.

title: J&K's 'Mini Switzerland' Is In Nature's Lap. Its Remoteness Became A Curse
content: Till Tuesday morning, Baisaran meadow in Pahalgam was Kashmir's 'mini Switzerland', a tourist hotspot known for jaw-dropping views of the Himalayas and the Valley's signature pine forests

title: Pakistanis On Medical Visas Told To Leave Country Within 5 Days
content: India on Thursday announced that medical visas issued to all Pakistanis will be valid only till April 29, as it stepped up measures against the neighbouring country in the wake of the terror attack in Pahalgam in Jammu & Kashmir.

title: India Could Be The First Country To Sign Trade Deal With US To Avoid Tariffs
content: Currently, the 26% reciprocal tariff on India that the US imposed is on a 90-day suspension. The pause will expire on July 8th. However, India does face a 10% tariff as other nations per the US trade policy.

title: Blog: Blog | A Day in Pahalgam Before Terror Struck
content: As my plane descended on the runway at Srinagar, my memory took me back to 35 years ago when I had gone to cover Kashmir as a reporter. Kashmir then was burning. Many people speculated that the days were not far when Kashmir would not be part of Indi

title: With Eyes On Pakistan, India Speeds Up Launch Of Special Spy Satellite
content: The Indian space agency is accelerating the launch of a special spy satellite that can help protect and keep a sharp eye on India's borders in the wake of the terrorist attack in Pahalgam.

title: "What Is His Mother's Fault?" Supreme Court During Vikas Yadav's Bail Hearing
content: Vikas Yadav, who serving a 25-year jail term in the 2002 murder case, is seeking interim bail to attend his ailing mother.

title: Video: "Precision Engagement" - Indian Destroyer Takes Down Sea-Skimming Target
content: A guided missile destroyer of the Indian Navy today destroyed a sea-skimming target in a "precision cooperative engagement".

title: Myanmar TikTok Astrologer Arrested For Spreading Panic After Quake Prediction
content: Myanmar authorities have arrested a TikTok astrologer for spreading panic by predicting another strong earthquake in the aftermath of last month's tremor, state media said Thursday.

title: 23-Year-Old From Delhi NEET Aspirant Dies By Suicide In Kota: Cops
content: The body of a 23-year-old NEET aspirant from Delhi was found near a railway track here early Thursday, police said.

title: Crimea Becomes New Flashpoint In Russia-Ukraine War: Why It Is Contested
content: Trump chided the Ukrainian leader for refusing to recognise Russia's occupation of Crimea as part of a U.S. peace deal to end the war in Ukraine.

title: Man, 50, Allegedly Beaten To Death By Railway Cops Inside Moving Train
content: A 50-year-old labourer died after being allegedly beaten by Government Railway Police (GRP) constables in the general coach of the Gondwana Express.

title: Expert's picks, best bets: Can Machado Garry elude Prates' hard strikes?
content: welterweight contenders Ian Machado Garry and Carlos Prates will clash to determine who moves closer to a title shot at UFC Fight Night on sunday . the fight follows the first loss of his career against Shavkat Rakhmonov in December .

title: BSF jawan detained by Pak Rangers after he accidentally crosses border
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the toi news desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide .

title: Rattled by India, Pak suspends Simla peace treaty: What is it?
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: NBA playoff odds: Lakers solidify top-5 championship odds after Game 2 win
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers , Denver Nuggets and Minnesota Timberwolves all have better odds . they have traded series-favorite status with their Game 1 and Game 2 wins .

title: Why Nico Iamaleava soured on Tennessee and ended up at UCLA
content: Iamaleava was set to make around $2.4 million at Tennessee this year, sources say . sources close to the quarterback deny they were seeking $4 million . he needed to take a "mental break" after the Vols' 42-17 loss to the college football world .

title: Western Conference takeaways: Butler injured in Game 2 as Rockets even series
content: no. 4 seed Denver Nuggets and no. 5 seed LA Clippers played another close thriller . the series now heads to Intuit Dome in Inglewood for the first playoff games . last set of Game 2s resumed Wednesday as the no. 2 seed Houston Rockets tied the series against the No. 7 seed Golden State Warriors .

title: Power Rankings: Who's No. 1 one month into the season?
content: just 2.5 games separate four teams -- three of which have winning percentages above .600 -- in the NL West . in the american league, while the Yankees are playing as well as projected, a number of teams are hovering around .500, the Orioles are scuffling and the Twins have the second-worst record in the league .

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Hurricanes new favorites following Avalanche Game 2 loss
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs have begun with 16 teams looking to be the last one standing after four rounds of playoff hockey action . the Florida Panthers return to defend their championship, but will have to contend with regular-season powerhouses including the Winnipeg Jets , Washington Capitals and Edmonton Oilers . they have emerged as the Eastern Conference favorites thanks to a 2-0 series lead over the banged-up New Jersey Devils .
